thread.title: These adorable family photos will make you happy the Patriots won the Super Bowl
thread.title_full: These adorable family photos will make you happy the Patriots won the Super Bowl

author: Jacob Lauing
title: These adorable family photos will make you happy the Patriots won the Super Bowl
text:
These adorable family photos will make you happy the Patriots won the Super Bowl 100 Tom Brady and his daughter, Vivian. Image: Jamie Squire/Getty Images By Jacob Lauing 2017-02-06 21:40:01 UTC 
Once again, the New England Patriots are Super Bowl champions . After faltering early in Super Bowl LI , the Patriots overcame a 25-point deficit to beat the Atlanta Falcons in overtime. 
A comeback of such epic proportions warrants an equally epic celebration. Luckily, the Patriots did not disappoint, with photos capturing plenty of beautiful moments players shared with their families after the game. 
Here are a handful of those lovely Kodak moments. Martellus Benefit's family thrived after the Super Bowl 
Bennett's daughter, Jett, stole the show at his postgame news conference, and also joined her dad in a pair of Instagram posts. A photo posted by Martellus Bennett (@martellusb) on Feb 6, 2017 at 2:09am PST A photo posted by Martellus Bennett (@martellusb) on Feb 6, 2017 at 1:46am PST Nate Solder's tear-jerking moment with his son 
This photo is already spectacular, as Patriots offensive tackle Nate Solder lets his son, Hudson, don a gigantic football helmet. But the moment gains even more weight when you learn that Hudson was diagnosed with kidney cancer in 2015. 
Image: Getty Images 
Nate, a testicular cancer survivor himself, said it gave him a new perspective on life. 
"The air we breathe is precious and to be at this game is a sign that you aren't always able to choose what you get, but you get some amazing things in life," he said leading up to the Super Bowl. Chris Hogan on the phone with his wife A photo posted by Chris Hogan (@chrishogan_15) on Feb 6, 2017 at 7:33am PST 
Though Hogan's wife, Ashley Boccio, couldn't make it to the game, the Patriots wide receiver made sure to call "the most special woman" in his life after the big win. Tom Brady is #FamilyGoals 
As if winning his fifth Super Bowl ring and fourth Super Bowl MVP award wasn't enough, Tom Brady showed off his beautiful family as well. The New England Patriots quarterback posted this photo on Instagram early Monday, calling his family, "My everything." A photo posted by Tom Brady (@tombrady) on Feb 6, 2017 at 7:07am PST 
After the game, cameras swarmed Brady, who kept his family close by. 
Brady with his wife Gisele Bundchen and daughter Vivian. 
Image: Kevin C. Cox/Getty Images Patrick Chung gets two trophies A photo posted by Patrick Chung (@23patrickchung) on Feb 5, 2017 at 10:22pm PST 
The Patriots defensive back simultaneously held his son and Lombardi Trophy, which probably weighs a lot more. Chris Long's son is v into confetti 
The defensive end's son Waylon looks particularly at ease among the celebratory confetti. A photo posted by Chris Long üÜë‚ö°Ô∏è (@laflamablanca95) on Feb 6, 2017 at 10:21am PST 
The Patriots found themselves as champions on football 's biggest stage. But these photos prove family comes first, even after one of the greatest comebacks in Super Bowl history.
